titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) إِذَا شَاءُوا أَنْ يَعْلَمُوا عُلِّمُوا
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup>, whenever they<sup>asws</sup> desire to know (something), they<sup>asws</sup> know (it)

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) يَعْلَمُونَ مَتَى يَمُوتُونَ وَ أَنَّهُمْ لَا يَمُوتُونَ إِلَّا بِاخْتِيَارٍ مِنْهُمْ
titles.en: Chapter 47 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> are knowing when they<sup>asws</sup> would be passing away, and they<sup>asws</sup> are not passing away except by a choice from them<sup>asws</sup>
Chapter 45 – In it is the Mention of the Unseen

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) إِذَا شَاءُوا أَنْ يَعْلَمُوا عُلِّمُوا
titles.en: Chapter 46 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup>, whenever they<sup>asws</sup> desire to know (something), they<sup>asws</sup> know (it)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (118/ 3)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ غَيْرُهُ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ أَيُّوبَ بْنِ نُوحٍ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ بَدْرِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ عَنْ أَبِي الرَّبِيعِ الشَّامِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ الْإِمَامَ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنْ يَعْلَمَ عُلِّمَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad and someone else, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ayoub Bin Nuh, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from Ibn Muskan, from Badr Bin Al Waleed, from Abu Al Rabie Al Shamy,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The Imam<sup>asws</sup>, whenever he<sup>asws</sup> desires that he<sup>asws</sup> knows (something), knows (it)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Muhammad and others have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad from Ayyub ibn Nuh from Safwan ibn Yahya from ibn Muskan from Badr ibn al-Walid from abu al-Rabi‘ al-Shami from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “Would the Imam (a.s.) like to know he would know.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/118)

narrator_chain.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ مُسْكَانَ عَنْ بَدْرِ بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ عَنْ أَبِي الرَّبِيعِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ الْإِمَامَ إِذَا شَاءَ أَنْ يَعْلَمَ أُعْلِمَ .

en.hubeali: Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Safwan, from Ibn Muskan, from Badr Bin Al Waleed, from Abu Al Rabie,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The Imam<sup>asws</sup>, whenever he<sup>asws</sup> so desires to know (something), knows (it)’.
en.sarwar: 2. Abu Ali al-Ash‘ari has narrated from Muhammad ibn ‘Abd al-Jabbar from Safwan from ibn Muskan from Badr ibn al-Walid from Abu al-Rabi‘ from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “Would the Imam (a.s.) want to know he would know.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول أيضا - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (3/119)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ سَعِيدٍ الْمَدَائِنِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عُبَيْدَةَ الْمَدَائِنِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِذَا أَرَادَ الْإِمَامُ أَنْ يَعْلَمَ شَيْئاً أَعْلَمَهُ اللَّهُ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Imran Bin Musa, from Musa Bin Ja’far, from Amro Bin Saeed Al Madainy, from Abu Ubeyda Al Madainy,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Whenever the Imam<sup>asws</sup> intends to know something, Allah<sup>azwj</sup> let him<sup>asws</sup> know that’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from ‘Umrah ibn Musa from Musa ibn Ja‘far from ‘Amr ibn Sa‘id al-Mada’ini from abu ‘Ubayda al-Mada’ini from abu ‘Abdallah (a.s.) who has said the following. “When the Imam (a.s.) would will to know something Allah will grant him such knowledge.”
